content:
• Monday, July 8, 2013
  • ISRG

    Shares of Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) get slammed in the post-session after warning of a...

    Shares of Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) get slammed in the post-session after warning of a big miss in Q2, with sales expected 8.8% below the $630M projected by analysts. The company blames reduced hospital admissions and insurance companies that are "encouraging conservative management and treatment in out patient settings." Shares -11.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM | 9 Comments
  • AMRN

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) announces a 21.7M share ADS offering, with a 30-day option to purchase an...

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) announces a 21.7M share ADS offering, with a 30-day option to purchase an additional 3.255M ADSs. Citigroup and Jefferies are acting as joint book-runners. Shares -6.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 6 Comments
  • APU

    AmeriGas Partners (NYSE:APU) -3.6% AH on news an affiliate of Energy Transfer Partners (ETP) has...

    AmeriGas Partners (NYSE:APU) -3.6% AH on news an affiliate of Energy Transfer Partners (ETP) has commenced a public offering of 6M APU common units it currently holds.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • XXIA

    Ixia (NASDAQ:XXIA) -2.7% AH after warning it expects Q2 revenue of $114M-$116M, below prior...

    Ixia (NASDAQ:XXIA) -2.7% AH after warning it expects Q2 revenue of $114M-$116M, below prior guidance of $119M-$122M and a $120.1M consensus. The network test equipment maker blames "extended review cycles" and deal push-outs from networking OEMs and service providers. However, Ixia adds demand from top customers AT&T and Cisco was strong, book-to-bill was above 1, and sales for 2012 acquisitions Anue and BreakingPoint were at the high end of expectations. The warning could have implications for rival JDS Uniphase (JDSU).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • WDFC

    More on WD-40 (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ3 beats across the board, as the company posts solid growth in...

    More on WD-40 (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ3 beats across the board, as the company posts solid growth in its core product lines. For the FY, it sees is EPS coming in at $2.40 - $2.48 per share, versus the consensus of $2.39. The company sees FY13 revenue of between $356M - $370M, towards the higher end of the consensus of $359.14M. Shares +9.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • WDFC

    WD-40 (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ3 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $93.1M beats by $3.65M. (PR)

    WD-40 (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ3 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $93.1M beats by $3.65M. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • SCSC

    ScanSource (NASDAQ:SCSC) -4.5% AH after announcing it expects to post Q2 revenue of $707M-$717M,...

    ScanSource (NASDAQ:SCSC) -4.5% AH after announcing it expects to post Q2 revenue of $707M-$717M, below a $724.2M consensus and representing a 5%-6% Y/Y drop. Full Q2 results arrive on Aug. 22. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • APPCQ

    American Apparel (APP) announces a $15M increase in its revolving credit facility with Capital...

    American Apparel (APP) announces a $15M increase in its revolving credit facility with Capital One Leverage Finance, under substantially the same terms of the existing facility. As a part of the transaction, The Bank of Montreal was added as a loan participant and the total commitment under the facility was raised to $50M from $35M. Shares +2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • AA

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA): FQ2 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $5.8B misses by $0.15B. Shares...

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA): FQ2 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $5.8B misses by $0.15B. Shares +1.52% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 13 Comments
  • NRP

    OCI Resources, a newly launched affiliate of soda ash producer OCI Wyoming, files plans to raise...

    OCI Resources, a newly launched affiliate of soda ash producer OCI Wyoming, files plans to raise up to $115M through an IPO. In January, Natural Resource Partners (NRP +2.1%) paid $292M for a 48.5% interest in OCI Wyoming, a subsidiary of South Korea's OCI Co. and the world's fifth-largest producer of soda ash.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRUS

    Apple-dependent Cirrus Logic (CRUS -2.3%) and OmniVision (OVTI -3.4%) are finishing the day...

    Apple-dependent Cirrus Logic (CRUS -2.3%) and OmniVision (OVTI -3.4%) are finishing the day lower. On top of a general selloff in chip stocks (spurred by Intel, Samsung, and PC industry worries), shares are likely pressured by a Wedge Partners report claiming Apple is cutting iPhone build orders by 20%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • CBLI

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI +3.3%) is set to finish the day higher after it, Incuron - a joint...

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI +3.3%) is set to finish the day higher after it, Incuron - a joint venture between CBLI and Bioprocess Capital Ventures - and Roswell Park Cancer Institute publish a study in the peer journal Cell Reports describing the Facilitates Chromatin Transcription complex as an accelerator of tumor transformation and a potential marker and target for aggressive cancers. The complex is the molecular target for Curaxins, a new class of anti-cancer compounds currently being developed by Incuron.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • ASEI

    American Science & Engineering (ASEI +2.2%) says it's received orders for two Z Portal...

    American Science & Engineering (ASEI +2.2%) says it's received orders for two Z Portal multi-view X-ray screening systems from two separate Middle East government agencies. One Z Portal system will be used for security at a port, while the other will provide security screening at a critical infrastructure facility. Both systems will be used to scan vehicles and trucks to detect explosive threats and contraband.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • DQ

    Shares of polysilicon manufacturer Daqo New Energy (DQ -19.7%) collapse on more than four times...

    Shares of polysilicon manufacturer Daqo New Energy (DQ -19.7%) collapse on more than four times the stock's average 10-day volume. In industry news, the German Economy Ministry says China will not impose import duties on polysilicon imported from the EU, good news for European manufacturers like Frankfurt-listed Wacker Chemie (OTC:WKCMF). Kudos to SA contributor Sneha Shah, who last Friday predicted the shares would fall. (Also: Hoku files for Chapter 7)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • CVI

    Refiners are oversold, Tudor Pickering says, after margins have been squeezed as WTI prices...

    Refiners are oversold, Tudor Pickering says, after margins have been squeezed as WTI prices climb much faster than Brent. As North American supply growth continues, the spread will widen and support refiners' stocks, the firm says; with refiners off 20%-40% from their peaks, believers in North American crude supply growth should be buying here. CVI +6.3%, HFC +4.7%, PSX +2.9%, TSO +2.5%, VLO +1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 5 Comments
  • ACTV

    Active Network (ACTV +3.8%) rallies as rival event/meeting management site Cvent files for a...

    Active Network (ACTV +3.8%) rallies as rival event/meeting management site Cvent files for a $100M IPO under the symbol CVT. Cvent posted 2012 revenue of $83.5M (+37% Y/Y), and net income of $4.3M.  Q1 sales totaled $24.4M (+33% Y/Y), and net income $310K. For reference, ACTV had 2012 sales of $418.9M, and a net loss of $43M. Cvent relies on a database of 200K+ venues to connect event planners with venue providers, and claimed 6.2K+ event planner customers at the end of 2012.  The company also sells "marketing solutions" to venue providers. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (JAZZ +1%) ticks up on positive comments out of Cantor Fitzgerald's Irina...

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (JAZZ +1%) ticks up on positive comments out of Cantor Fitzgerald's Irina Rivkind today, who reiterates her Buy rating on the shares with a price target of $86. Rivkind thinks recent FDA developments will continue to benefit the company, with a favorable settlement outcome on Xyrem that would allow it to introduce its deuterated brand extension and preserve the revenues associated with the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • ANGI

    Angie's List (ANGI -2.7%) slumps after a site called The Truth About Angie's List launches....

    Angie's List (ANGI -2.7%) slumps after a site called The Truth About Angie's List launches. Among other things, the site accuses the local services reviews provider of deceptive marketing practices and failing to conduct background checks on service providers. Also: SA contributor has George Kesarios provided a bearish write-up. He highlights a declining ratio between subscriber and service provider revenue (viewed as diminishing the value of Angie's List to service providers), as well as a deteriorating cash position and a rising short interest.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • CKSW

    ClickSoftware (CKSW -11.3%) falls hard after warning it expects Q2 revenue of $24.5M and EPS of...

    ClickSoftware (CKSW -11.3%) falls hard after warning it expects Q2 revenue of $24.5M and EPS of -$0.06 to -$0.08, below a consensus of $27.8M and $0.03. 2013 revenue guidance has been lowered to a range of $110M-$115M, below a $120.5M consensus. The provider of workforce management/field service software blames delayed deal closings stemming from a faster-than-expected shift to cloud software.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • TKR

    Timken (TKR -1.9%) slips today after hitting a new 52-week high last week. Bank of America (Buy)...

    Timken (TKR -1.9%) slips today after hitting a new 52-week high last week. Bank of America (Buy) cuts its price target on the shares to $65 from $68 noting that although there is likely "further embedded value [on] a high probability of a split up … forecasts for a sharp H2 rebound need to come down in light of sluggish top-line momentum."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • JNY

    The Jones Group (JNY +9.1%) trades higher again on M&A chatter. The retailer has reportedly...

    The Jones Group (JNY +9.1%) trades higher again on M&A chatter. The retailer has reportedly hired Citigroup to explore a sale of the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • DAVE

    Dougherty starts Famous Dave's (DAVE +2.1%) at Buy with a $20 price target. Analyst Gregory...

    Dougherty starts Famous Dave's (DAVE +2.1%) at Buy with a $20 price target. Analyst Gregory McKinley says that while the business may be fairly priced today, the market is "significantly mispricing" the stock's earnings potential "even without contributions from future store development."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • QCOM

    Chip stocks underperform (SOXX -1.8%) thanks to an Intel downgrade, negative PC commentary, and...

    Chip stocks underperform (SOXX -1.8%) thanks to an Intel downgrade, negative PC commentary, and worries about Samsung's light profit forecast. Citi's Glen Yeung, who just cut his Intel estimates and pulled Qualcomm (QCOM -1.7%) from his firm's Top Picks Live list, notes smartphone penetration in developed markets (where high-end sales are concentrated) has hit 75%, and frets about a "lack of new, innovative features" in high-end phones. SWKS -3.4%. MRVL -2.9%. SMTC -3%. AVGO -3.1%. ADNC -4.3%. SNDK -2.4%. TQNT -2.4%. ATML -2.5%. TSM -3.2%. Chip ETFs: SMH, XSD, PSI, SOXL, USD, SOXS, SSG. (SIA sales data)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 3 Comments
  • CFX

    Colfax (CFX -4%) slips on a Deutsche Bank downgrade from Buy to Hold on valuation as it...

    Colfax (CFX -4%) slips on a Deutsche Bank downgrade from Buy to Hold on valuation as it approaches the firm's $54 price target. Deutsche says that it still sees more upside potential for the shares, but cautions that it carries the most exposure to higher growth/emerging markets within its coverage universe, and a lack of improvement in emerging markets could, at minimum, delay prospective volume recovery in the company's short cycle welding business and limit earnings upside in the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • LUNA

    Midday top 10 gainers: LUNA +43%. CREG +22%. NBG +14%. GPRC +12%. DLIA +12%. OTC:RGDX +12%. PETX...

    Midday top 10 gainers: LUNA +43%. CREG +22%. NBG +14%. GPRC +12%. DLIA +12%. OTC:RGDX +12%. PETX +11%. LINE +11%. LPTH +11%. PGNX +11%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: DQ -20%. MNDL -13%. BABY -13%. USU -12%. EMITF -10%. TAOM -10%. CKSW -10%. PME -9%. ORMP -9%. AFOP -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • DATA

    Tableau (DATA -3.3%) slides after Pac Crest starts coverage with a Sector Perform. Shares are...

    Tableau (DATA -3.3%) slides after Pac Crest starts coverage with a Sector Perform. Shares are still up 97% from May's $31 IPO price, and trade at ~25x 2012 sales. (underwriter coverage)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • GDOT

    Shares of Green Dot (GDOT +1.3%) poke out another gain and are now up over 60% YTD. BTIG...

    Shares of Green Dot (GDOT +1.3%) poke out another gain and are now up over 60% YTD. BTIG Research thinks the company could benefit if there is a crackdown on company payroll cards as employees without bank account look to Green Dot's prepaid debit cards as an attractive direct deposit option.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • TRS

    Shares in TriMas Corp (TRS -6.6%) slide on heavier-than-normal volume, dropping from a 52-week...

    Shares in TriMas Corp (TRS -6.6%) slide on heavier-than-normal volume, dropping from a 52-week high of $40.79 after Sidoti cut its rating to Neutral from Buy on valuation. The stock has been on fire recently, rising over 37% since late-April.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • NURO

    NeuroMetrix (NURO +4.2%) gets 510(k) clearance from the FDA for the Sensus Pain Management...

    NeuroMetrix (NURO +4.2%) gets 510(k) clearance from the FDA for the Sensus Pain Management system to be used during sleep. The indication is particularly encouraging given that the FDA requires that "transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulators … carry a warning against use during sleep, primarily because of electrical hazards following dislodgement of electrodes." NURO's device uses a proprietary algorithm to mitigate the risk and is the first such device cleared by regulators for overnight use. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • SBGL

    Platinum prices surge as thousands of Amplats mineworkers in South Africa launch a wildcat...

    Platinum prices surge as thousands of Amplats mineworkers in South Africa launch a wildcat strike overnight. The country accounts for ~75% of the global platinum supply and has been dogged by labor disputes in the past year. Taking advantage may be Stillwater Mining (SWC +3%), which operates a platinum recycling plant that should help it meet platinum demand without having to produce more.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • CYT

    Cytec Industries (CYT +4.2%) gets a lift this morning as Goldman Sachs upgrades the shares to...

    Cytec Industries (CYT +4.2%) gets a lift this morning as Goldman Sachs upgrades the shares to Buy from Sell, and raises its price target from $69 to $93. Goldman says that with Boeing's Dreamliner battery issues resolved ahead of an inflection in build rates, CYT's multiple expansion has room to run, particularly within its Aerospace Unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • IGC

    India Globalization Capital (OTC:IGC +12%) pops today after saying it signed an iron ore supply...

    India Globalization Capital (OTC:IGC +12%) pops today after saying it signed an iron ore supply pact with Mon Resources International on July 3. Under terms of the pact, IGC will purchase 126K metric tons of 54% iron ore delivered to its hub on Mongolia's border with China. OTC:IGC's Chinese subsidiary will then beneficiate this ore to 66% Fe content ahead of its sale to the steel mills. The shipments are expected to begin in August and projected to generate between $10Mto $12M in revenue, based on current pricing.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • PBF

    PBF Energy (PBF -4.3%) is downgraded to Equal Weight from Overweight with a $28 price...

    PBF Energy (PBF -4.3%) is downgraded to Equal Weight from Overweight with a $28 price target at Morgan Stanley. With its rail transport facility, PBF should deliver Bakken crude to the east coast at ~$12/bbl by year-end, or $2-$3/bbl below other east coast refiners, but the firm sees higher RIN prices as a headwind, with an estimated 2013 RIN obligation of ~$225M at current prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • FMD

    First Marblehead (FMD +10.6%) adds to big gains this year after SA Pro's Jonathan Verenger...

    First Marblehead (FMD +10.6%) adds to big gains this year after SA Pro's Jonathan Verenger reminds not to forget about this once-highflying student loan lender as it moves towards stepping back into the lucrative securitization market (embargoed until tomorrow morning).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • NVAX

    Novavax (NVAX +1.9%) says it's begun enrollment for Phase 1 clinical trials of its A(H7N9)...

    Novavax (NVAX +1.9%) says it's begun enrollment for Phase 1 clinical trials of its A(H7N9) vaccine candidate for the prevention of avian flu. Research on the drug has progressed rapidly, moving from viral gene sequencing, to vaccine candidacy, to multiple animal studies, and now, just three months after the gene sequence was obtained, into a clinical trial.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • OSK

    Barrington upgrades Oshkosh (OSK +1.8%) to Outperform from Market Perform.

    Barrington upgrades Oshkosh (OSK +1.8%) to Outperform from Market Perform.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (WLT +7.2%) rips higher, possibly due to positive comments from Davenport...

    Walter Energy (WLT +7.2%) rips higher, possibly due to positive comments from Davenport indicating that WLT will provide an update on progress in getting waivers from its lenders. Simmons also says WLT's banking group remains supportive and an amendment providing covenant relief is likely in the next few months. Other coal names also move: ANR +2.9%, JRCC +3.4%, ACI +2.4%, CNX +3%, BTU +3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • ASTX

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX +3.6%) jumps after the company says it plans to submit an IND for...

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX +3.6%) jumps after the company says it plans to submit an IND for ASTX727 (a combo of decitabine and the cytidine deaminase inhibitor E7727) in Q4. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • OHRP

    Ohr Pharmaceutical (OHRP +2.6%) reaches 50% enrollment for a trial of Squalamine, an eye drop...

    Ohr Pharmaceutical (OHRP +2.6%) reaches 50% enrollment for a trial of Squalamine, an eye drop treatment for wet age-related macular degeneration which the company hopes can compete with Regeneron's (REGN -1.4%) Eylea and Genentech's (OTCQX:RHHBY +0.2%) Lucentis (which Novartis has the rights to outside the U.S.).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • ARCT

    Biopharm company Alcobra (ADHD +4%) gets a lift from Aegis Capital this morning, who initiates...

    Biopharm company Alcobra (ADHD +4%) gets a lift from Aegis Capital this morning, who initiates coverage with a Buy rating and a price target of $30 per share. The stock has been something of a disappointment since its IPO debut in May. It priced at $8 and immediately broke below on its first day of trading, and still remains 11% underwater.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • BTE

    In an operations update, Baytex Energy (BTE +1.6%) says it expects average Q2 production of...

    In an operations update, Baytex Energy (BTE +1.6%) says it expects average Q2 production of 57.5K-58K boe/day, up 11% Q/Q and up 9% Y/Y; FY 2013 production guidance remains at 56K-58K boe/day. Q2 production from its Peace River properties is estimated at 23K bbl/day, up 22% Q/Q and 19% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • LULU

    Canaccord Genuity backs Lululemon (LULU +2.5%) for future gains with its view that domestic and...

    Canaccord Genuity backs Lululemon (LULU +2.5%) for future gains with its view that domestic and global demand will remain strong for the brand. Shares of LULU are on their way to breaking a five-session losing streak today.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • ROAN

    While BofA says it isn't calling an outcome of the SEC review in its upgrade of Linn Energy...

    While BofA says it isn't calling an outcome of the SEC review in its upgrade of Linn Energy (LINE +13.2%), it is a clear affirmation of LINE's most controversial accounting practices. The firm says LINE's accounting for derivatives used to hedge its production and the capex it sets aside to maintain energy output haven't misled investors or put the company's high dividend at risk. LNCO +12%, BRY +0.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 7 Comments
  • AMTD

    TD Ameritrade (AMTD +1.9%) is off to a good start following an upgrade to Buy at Citigroup, with...

    TD Ameritrade (AMTD +1.9%) is off to a good start following an upgrade to Buy at Citigroup, with price target lifted to $29 from $25. The online discount brokers are cruising through the interest rate scare as higher rates (all else being equal) should boost their bottom lines.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • MLCO

    Sterne Agee hikes Q2 EBITDA forecasts for Melco Crown (MPEL +1.6%), Las Vegas Sands (LVS +1.5%),...

    Sterne Agee hikes Q2 EBITDA forecasts for Melco Crown (MPEL +1.6%), Las Vegas Sands (LVS +1.5%), and MGM, citing Macau data checks and "other factors." Analyst David Bain notes that his Q2 "EBITDA forecasts for MPEL, LVS, and MGM are now 20%, 3%, and 2% above consensus" respectively.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • MGM

    Casino stocks start the week strong off of positive reports from Macau on gambling revenue and...

    Casino stocks start the week strong off of positive reports from Macau on gambling revenue and brisk casino traffic. Advancers: MGM +2.7%, LVS +1.3%, MPEL +1.6%, WYNN +1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • AGNC

    Investors tiptoe back into mREITs (REM +0.7%) following Friday's drubbing which was the...

    Investors tiptoe back into mREITs (REM +0.7%) following Friday's drubbing which was the exclamation point (at least the bulls hope so) on 3 months of major losses for the sector. In what could turn out to be a sell side classic, Wunderlich cuts a swath of pummeled names from Buy to Hold: American Capital (AGNC), (MTGE +0.7%), CYS (CYS +1.2%), Invesco (IVR +0.9%), Western Asset (WMC -0.4%), AG (MITT -2.5%). Others of interest this morning: Annaly (NLY +1.6%), Armour (ARR +1.2%), Hatteras (HTS +0.6%), MFA (MFA +0.4%), Anworth (ANH +1.8%), Dynex (DX +1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 11 Comments
  • INO

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals' (INO +14.7%) vaccine for the newly emergent A/Anhui/1/13 subtype of the...

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals' (INO +14.7%) vaccine for the newly emergent A/Anhui/1/13 subtype of the H7N9 strain of bird flu protected 100% of mice in a pre-clinical study, with all the animals surviving despite receiving a lethal dose of the virus. However, Inovio is behind Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX), which has already started Phase I trials for A/Anhui/1/13-like A(H7N9). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 2 Comments
  • ARP

    Atlas Resource (ARP +4.3%), BreitBurn Energy (BBEP +4.8%), Atlas Energy (OTC:ATLS +3.9%) and...

    Atlas Resource (ARP +4.3%), BreitBurn Energy (BBEP +4.8%), Atlas Energy (OTC:ATLS +3.9%) and LinnCo (LNCO +7.5%) are upgraded to Outperform at Baird after last week's losses in upstream MLPs. Specific issues remain - Linn Energy's SEC inquiry and uncertainty around the Berry merger, EVEP's leverage and Utica sales disappointments - but on balance the firm sees a good opening for longs.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 3 Comments
  • LUNA

    Shares of Luna Innovations (LUNA +73.8%) skyrocket as the company announces a multi-year...

    Shares of Luna Innovations (LUNA +73.8%) skyrocket as the company announces a multi-year agreement with Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -0.5%) which expands upon the existing agreement between the companies regarding the integration of LUNA's "high-speed shape-sensing technology into ISRG's platform for robotically-assisted minimally invasive surgery." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • NVAX

    Novavax's (NVAX +2.3%) vaccine for respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) appears to have...

    Novavax's (NVAX +2.3%) vaccine for respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) appears to have performed well in a Phase I trial of elderly people, with all 220 subjects exhibiting antibody responses against RSV at 28 and 56 days. With subjects also receiving a flu vaccine, the data paves the way for a combo drug (PR). Meanwhile, Novavax has started a Phase I trial for a vaccine for a strain of bird flu called A/Anhui/1/13-like A(H7N9). The trial will recruit 280 adults (PR).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • CDE

    Coeur d'Alene Mines (CDE -1.7%) says a preliminary assessment of its La Preciosa project in...

    Coeur d'Alene Mines (CDE -1.7%) says a preliminary assessment of its La Preciosa project in Mexico indicates a 17-year initial mine life, with average annual silver production of 9.1M oz. in the first 14 years. At forecast production rates, La Preciosa would be one of the top 10 primary silver mines in the world. Meanwhile, shares are downgraded to Sector Underperform with a $6 price target at Scotia Capital.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 3 Comments
  • INTC

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes: 1) Evercore has downgraded Intel (INTC -1.5%) to...

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes: 1) Evercore has downgraded Intel (INTC -1.5%) to Underweight. Also, Citi has cut its estimates for Intel. 2) Citi has removed Qualcomm (QCOM -0.5%) from its Top Picks Live list. 3) Needham has downgraded contract manufacturers Flextronics (FLEX -0.9%), Plexus (PLXS -1%), and Benchmark Electronics (BHE -1%) to Hold. 4) HSBC has upgraded China Unicom (CHU +0.7%) to Neutral. 5) Jefferies has started Nintendo (OTCPK:NTDOY) at Buy. 6) Evercore has downgraded ON Semi (ONNN -2.7%) to Equal Weight. 7) Barclays has downgraded VeriFone (PAY -1.2%) to Equal Weight.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures follow European shares higher ahead of the start of earnings...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures follow European shares higher ahead of the start of earnings season, and after the political situation in Portugal stabilizes further and Greece agrees to a deal with Troika that should see the country receive the next installment of its bailout. However, with many traders on an extended weekend break, the action is light and volatile. The S&P Mini +0.5%. Later: Consumer credit
